page.title: 08HEALTH
page.content: So far as the large American community in this area is concerned there are less health problems than usual due to the adult age range of 18-45 years. Military personnel undergo regular rigorous health checks and physical conditioning. Again, due to the age range there is a high birth rate. Some Americans choose to have babies in local hospitals. The nearest American hospital is at RAF Lakenheath. As with any other community at this time there are a few problems of drug and alcohol abuse. In common with any other rural area the locals have a healthier atti- tude to illness than towndwellers, and because of their lifestyle seem to suffer less from mental stress & minor physical ailments. Local people are served by a group medical practice based at Alderton and hospital treat- ment is at Ipswich General Hospital.
